meanings.definition: To harm the reputation of someone or something
meanings.sent1: The false accusations discredited his good name in the town.
meanings.sent2: The scandal discredited the politician in the eyes of the public.
meanings.sent3: The rumor that he could fly discredited him as a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her constant lies discredited her as a trustworthy friend.
meanings.sent5: The doctored photo discredited the authenticity of the evidence.

meanings.definition: No longer considered valid or reliable
meanings.sent1: The discredited theory was no longer taught in schools.
meanings.sent2: The discredited product was removed from the market.
meanings.sent3: The discredited fortune teller still had a long line of believers.
meanings.sent4: His discredited promises left him with no supporters.
meanings.sent5: The discredited witness's testimony was dismissed in court.
